website_summaries.verdict: Fast, strong WiFi connectivity, up to 1 Gbps download speed, and convenient triple-play compatibility make this a top DOCSIS 3.0 modem.
pros: Runs triple-play setups (internet, voice, video) with no problems
Compatible with Xfinity and DOCSIS 3.0 networks
cons: Directly activating through Comcast tech support may be easier than through its website
Modem is larger than other brands, rising 10+ inches high

website_summaries.verdict: A great modem that does it all as long as you have internet service with Comcast.
pros: Includes modem and Wi-Fi router as well as support for Xfinity voice service
Features 24 download and eight upload channels
Ideal for Internet plans up to 600 Mbps
Wi-Fi speeds of up to 1750 Mbps
cons: Only works with Xfinity service from Comcast
Comcast will not provision this modem for Gig Speed services

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this modem is compatible with Xfinity Internet and Vocie. Yes, it works fine. BUT, it is NOT compatible with Xfinity’s Gig Speed Tier. You wouldn’t know that from just looking at the headline and product, it advertises speeds up to 1Gig, however Comcast requires a DOCSIS 3.1 modem. This is 3.0. This is falsely advertised and if I could get my money back I would. Don’t buy this unless you only want speeds 250Mb and below.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Sakowski

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the Xfinity rental with the Arris SVG2482AC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to replace the rented Comcast Xfinity Arris TG1682. The 2482 is most likely just the retail version of the TG1682. Self activated on the Comcast network and was up and running in just a few minutes. The Arris SVG2482AC is listed as compatible on the Xfinity approved modem list for my zip code. This is a DOCSIS 3.0 modem which is more than adequate for my internet plan.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: NEW item seems to be USED
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace my current ( rented) cable modem. I was doing a remodel so didnt install right away. I contacted Comcast ( my cable provider) and they couldn't activate it over the phone and recommended I take it to a Comcast office so the MAC address and serial number could be scanned into the system. I did that however the unit came up as being used.. and that the serial number and MAC address didnt match. This was scanning right off the item itself. They postulated this was a refurbished or used unit to return it. not a great experience so far..
customer_reviews.author: Lohoch

customer_reviews.title: ***Caution *** Caution***
customer_reviews.text: If you are picking this up for a Comcast Xfinity 1GB Internet... Don't! Comcast, only utilized (as of this writing) DOCSIS 3.1 and not, I REPEAT, NOT 3.0! THIS UNIT WILL NOT PROVIDE 1 GIGABIT INTERNET AS IT IS ONLY DOCSIS 3.0. However, if you're looking to replace your standard Comcast Xfinity 400 GB Internet and have phone and WiFi, than this unit will work fine. Again, according to the smart techs at Xfinity, YOU MUST HAVE A DEVICE THAT SUPPORTS DOCSIS 3.1 IF YOU WANT INTERNET SPEEDS OVER 400 MB DOWN AND 10 MB UP (RESIDENTIAL SERVICE THAT IS). Lastly, there are virtually no units that provide what this does in the 1 GB Internet World... Happy Hunting...
customer_reviews.author: Fred Renee

customer_reviews.title: Not Xfinity compatible.
customer_reviews.text: Surfboard is advertised a Xfinity compatable. Comcast can not get to work properly. Comcast sent out a tech who informed me this device was not supported. Tried contacting Mfg. No response and no other way to contact them
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Opitz

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS MODEM!
customer_reviews.text: 2 months in and this modem does not work. Had to pay for 2 Comcast service fees of $60 each. was not getting download speeds as paid for. switched to a Comcast modem for monthly fee. Upon connection instantly got the speeds advertised and paid for. Cannot return as only 30 day policy. Terrible product and I will not be careful about buying further electronics on Amazon. Poor return policy!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph V. Martino

customer_reviews.title: Pleased to replace my Xfinity rental
customer_reviews.text: The ARRIS Modem/Router arrived promptly. By virtue of the accompanying instructions, was effortless to connect> I called the ARRIS tech support just for reassurance and they advised me about contacting Xfinity to complete the installation and register this new model Modem/Router with its serial #. Much to my surprise, the Xfinity rep was equally helpful and deactivated the Xfinity modem. I then returned the Xfinity Modem/Router & power cord to the local Comcast office. I am delighted that I will no longer be paying the $13/month rental fee to Xfinity
customer_reviews.author: SCH

customer_reviews.title: Flakey chipset goes down; bridge mode doesn’t work correctly
customer_reviews.text: This modem has been a terrible performer. Bridge mode doesn’t work correctly, meaning you cannot reliably use another router and/or Wi-Fi station behind it (I use both a wired Ethernet router as well as an Apple AirPort Extreme). During the 6 months I’ve owned it with my Xfinity service, I’ve had toneeaet the modem at least 2 dozen times, and it has a firmware bug that makes bridge mode eventually stop working (search the Internet and you’ll find many reports of this problem). It’s a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: EveryoneIsAnotherYou

customer_reviews.title: Does not perform as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product...but it didn't perform as advertised. Supposedly certified to match Xfinity's 1GB internet service, but the download and upload speeds were nowhere in that range. Speed tests revealed download speeds around 17MBPS and upload speeds < 10MBPS. The Xfinity XB6 modem achieves download speeds near 400MBPS with upload speeds near 40MBPS on my desktop. Also, it did not bridge successfully to my Orbi router. Returned the unit to Amazon and kept the Xfinity XB6. 5 stars to Amazon for their fast and easy return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Bone MD

customer_reviews.title: Does not support 1 gig xfinity service
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like it, really did. Everything said it was a 1 gig gateway that was compatible with xfinity 1 gig service. xfinity website provided this as one of the devices to get if I wanted my own equipment for 1 gig service. Got it, set it up, got it activated but it would only pull 30Mbps download. Two hours of trouble shooting over the phone and a visit by an xfinity tech did not resolve the problem. I was flat out told that this device would not support xfinity 1 gig service. Period. They swapped out gateways and the problem was resolved. So this is both a review of the ARRIS Surfboard and the xfinity product suggestions website.
customer_reviews.author: Just some guy

customer_reviews.title: Not really satisfied with this modem. Will not recommend for anyone needing high speed modem
customer_reviews.text: The Ethernet ports not gigabit. See my picture. They’re only pulling maximum of 100mb even with my cat6e cable and I have 600mb plan with Comcast. Waste of money and my bandwidth since it’s downgrading me. My old leased modem from Comcast gets me at least 400mb download speed. Also it takes longtime to reboot so be aware you have to wait really long whenever you reboot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Gateway did not have a function it claimed!
customer_reviews.text: This specific ARRIS Gateway, Router, Telephony Modem was ordered because it clearly showed "MoCa" on the rear of the enclosure. Subsequently I purchased additional MoCa items From you and other vendors. After weeks of trying to activate MoCa with the help of your support technicians and ARRIS technical support we found the problem. ARRIS had stopped supporting MoCa on this particular model (and perhaps all models) without telling vendors or potential customers. EXTREMELY POOR REGARD FOR CUSTOMER SATISFACTION!!! I want to retyrn this product for an Better equivalent product at "NO" additional cost. Robert H. Irish
customer_reviews.author: Big Bad Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible for Xfinity high speed internet
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to let everyone know that this is NOT the modem to buy if you want something that is compatible with Xfinity's highest speed internet. We purchased this modem at the recommendation of Xfinity's customer service. We ended up needing 3 technicians onsite and 6 over the phone to determine that we needed a "three in one" modem for our internet speed. Unfortunately, it took longer than the return date to get everything resolved. We ended up just renting the modem from Xfinity. It's unfortunate that Xfinity and the manufacturer represent the product incorrectly. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Janine Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Stop paying modem rental!Invest in this instead
customer_reviews.text: Much better WiFi than the standard Xfinity provided Cable modem. The built in router really simplifies setup. Many of my wireless devices performed much better. The device can be utilized with an optional battery. The interal webpage setup is fairly straightfird. There are a lot of instruction memos on the page. The fact that most cable companies charge a $13 -$15 °a month retal fee this purchase was a total no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L. Bray

customer_reviews.title: Phone line doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Phone line didn't work. i called Xfinity and their support tried all they can to send signal. Modem and internet was working OK. But phone line light never cam fine. Xfinity asked to contact ARRIS and i knew whats going to happen next. ARRIS said phone lines are controlled by Xfinity and they can't debug. So asked me to send device back. This is second ARRIS device i had to send back and now wait for months to receive replacement.
customer_reviews.author: saggi

customer_reviews.title: A really good modem... but be prepared to deal with incompetent Comcast support.
customer_reviews.text: A really good modem once you get it activated through Comcast support. But be prepared to deal with major incompetence there. It took about 45 minutes on the phone to activate my modem (something that really shouldn't take more than 20 minutes). I could hear the Comcast rep asking other reps how to remove the Comcast modem from our account and add and activate this new one. Once they got that done, I realized that they didn't include my landline when they activated it (we have poor cell service where we live - so a landline is necessary). So it took an additional 15 minutes for the whole process for them to add my landline. The modem works great though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: No more Xfinity modem lease for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem as it is capable of working with all the Xfinity Triple Play services. This was newest Arris model just released, supported and Xfinity tech recommended this model to replace my leased older Arris Xfinity branded Triple Play modem. Got on phone with support and was setup within an hour with no issues after they registered the MAC and updated firmware. Going on a month now with no issues and great wireless coverage. No more modem lease... YAE.... Now if the cost was lower!
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: Does not play well with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Tech support call #1 told me I needed a separate router, because the product was only a modem. (it's both). Tech support call #2 told me I couldn't access port forwarding, because Xfinity blocked it. Xfinity was the one who suggested I get a non Xfinity modem/router so I could use port forwarding. Couldn't change a device from DHCP to a reserved address. The feature was there, the settings were correct, but would not save. All in all about 12 hours of my time wasted between Arris and Xfinity. Product returned
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Time Warner/Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a great device, just be warned this does not work with Time Warner/Spectrum. I had checked with Spectrum before purchasing and the representative told me it WOULD work, but he was wrong. The second person I talked to (after receiving the modem) said "oh, I see you talked with someone in the Philippines that day, I don't know why he told you that but we are getting rid of them soon anyway." I ended up buying a Motorola cable modem and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: C. Romano

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing performance
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to install with a decent signal. The problem is devices connected have very erratic bandwidth often slowing to unusable. More often than not I have to disconnect the WiFi and reconnect to reestablish a connection. Without changing location this will take the download speed from 5-6 mps (or less) to the 200+ where it’s suppose to be. Than an hour later it’s back to unusable and have to reconnect. Looking for an alternative because this device does not perform anywhere near as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sndmn

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Started out fine and stated having issues at about three months wifi would disappear and its connection to the internet would drop even for hardwired connections. At month six, it became useless and there were lots of errors so I went back to a Comcast owned modem. My connection has been solid since I went back to the Comcast modem with very little errors. It's too late to return this device so I am out over $200.
customer_reviews.author: LAL

customer_reviews.title: Double internet speed
customer_reviews.text: I was sick of spotty internet in the house and tired of paying Comcast a monthly fee to rent their mediocre equipment. I purchased the Arris and am enjoying much higher internet speeds. If you want to check your speed download the app Speedtest by ookla. With that app, I noticed that my husband’s office was at 150 with the old Comcast router/ modem and now 250 with Arris! Even the kitchen, on the opposite side of the house has speeds of 150+ (from 25). I returned the old equipment to comcast and will never again rent from them. This unit pays for itself.
customer_reviews.author: JDavis

customer_reviews.title: Almost works.
customer_reviews.text: Windows does not recognize it so it uses the name of the earlier voice modem router. Box says certified for Xfinity, but xfinity web site treats it as a third party device. No firmware updates or drivers available. I can get the internet but not all home networking sites are shown (phone, mac, etc). Do not get voice service unless you have to. I was happy with a Netgears modem, but xfinity said it wasn't supported by their voice/internet package. Customer support does not acknowledge issue although there are many posts on the web confirming this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Poor wifi range
customer_reviews.text: Installation and set up were mostly painless. Wi-fi set up required a couple minutes to set the password. The major flaw I experienced was the wifi range and penetration. The home is a 4 floor condo and the unit can not penetrate into the garage and service is inconsistent on any floors above the modem. Paying the extra $13/month rental fee is almost less painful. I wouldn’t recommend this to an orangutan.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: This is actually the same as what Xfinity will install for you.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the same as what Xfinity will install for you. We installed it under the guidance of XIfinity installation person. The only issues is (That's why I only give 4 stars) that devices in 2.4GHz and in 5GHz network do not communicate. It even has no routing table to let my laptop in 5GHz to see the printer in 2.4GHz. And, if the phone uses 5GHz, it cannot see the security cameras which are using 2.4GHz. However, in my Xfinity case, download speed in 2.4GHz is around 50Mbps and in 5GHz is around 170Mbps. Upload speeds are the same, around 11Mbps. I have been with ATT for 8 years and the download speed was around 8Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: D. Su

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup. Seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my existing xfinity modem with this. It will pay for itself in a year. Seems to be a little faster wifi than the xfinity modem but what was most impressive was the setup. I plugged in all the cables from the old modem then plugged the new modem in. It did take a while but then I went to the xfinity activate site (the instructions say if you are replacing a modem you should call, but I didn't). The site asked if I wanted to keep the same wifi names and passwords which I did and within 10 minutes I was done. Very impressive. I was expecting a lot more pain.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Akers

customer_reviews.title: Need to purchase the DOSIS 3.1 Modem
customer_reviews.text: My speeds have decreased and when I called Comcast they could not access the router portion because it is NOT their modem. They are now running DOSIS 3.1 and this router does not support it. I am having one of their techs try to do some changes that were told to me when I spoke with Arris tech support. Comcast does not use this type of modem any longer... I have Blast Pro, and should get speeds of around 175 Mbs, but for some reason now I only get around 75 Mbs...
customer_reviews.author: HMan

customer_reviews.title: Super fast speed, great WiFi coverage - w/Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem/router when I upgraded services with Comcast and ditched my Dish Network. I am seeing great wireless speeds download speeds as we are streaming a lot of tv/YouTube/Netflix etc. upload speed also tests great, but I don’t upload a bunch of stuff. Very happy with this and don’t have to lease the equipment. I haven’t hooked up a phone to this yet, but it is something I’ll do in the. Next couple weeks
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Solid cable modem including Invoice capability
customer_reviews.text: Interesting start to this purchase where the MAC ID of the first one I received had already been registered. The interesting thing was how Amazon handled it, they had a tech support take my call, connect me to Arris; the manufacture, the lady from Amazon stayed on the line as Arris confirmed that this MAC ID was already registered, and ordered a replacement immediately. So an unusual situation where a brand new model is already registered but full credit to how both Amazon and Arris handled it. The worst thing here was being out of a home phone for a few days but all is well. The new modem was perfect and works as expected
customer_reviews.author: Topgun

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: Arrived one day early! Easy to connect, and the activation with Comcast seemed to work perfectly online, but then there was an xFinity sign-in page that appeared whenever I tried to go online and it took a little while with the Xfinity customer service phone help to solve it. Eventually all was worked out and both the internet and phone connections are working perfectly. Best of all, I'm saving the $11 monthly equipment charge!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Provide 1G Internet
customer_reviews.text: Overall was happy with this router, but realized that it doesn't provide 1G internet although it says it can. It has a DOCSIS 3.0, which doesn't support 1G. Have to have DOCSIS 3.1 in order to support 1G apparently. Had the Comcast technician come in today because I noticed I wasn't getting my 1G speeds. Searched online to corroborate what the technician said, and it looks like this was a great Marketing ploy by Arris. I'm only getting 250 mbs
customer_reviews.author: Maximillian

customer_reviews.title: Works with Comcast/ Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to save money per month by owning our own modem/ router. This is the same one we replaced from Comcast but it’s white instead of black. This has the phone jacks built in. The only difference I have noticed, is the app where you can turn off certain things doesn’t work for me, now that I have an owned modem. Other than that it will pay for itself in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: cdl221

customer_reviews.title: poor range and slow speed
customer_reviews.text: I am sad to report that my attempts to save money by purchasing my own modem was a failure. I had no problems setting this unit up. However, even though I have a small home coverage was very limited, and the speed was very slow. After several weeks of frustration, including buying a range extender (which helped with range but not speed), I had a service appointment. Analysis of the unit demonstrated extremely slow speeds coming from the unit during testing, while speed from the cable were just fine. I ultimately replaced the unit with a different modem and both range and speed issues were resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: High quality cable modem
customer_reviews.text: High performance. High speed rating. Clear and concise instructions, from Quick Start to the initial installation gateway login. Security features in the built-in gateway administrator login are high quality. I know, as a former computer security consultant for large corporations. Worked with my local cable ISP provider for some time to get the new cable modem activated on the local cable ISP but that is unique to the cable service, and I attempted to do this during an announced cable ISP servie outage that may have affected the speed of completing the installation hand-shaking. Once that was done, the modem has provided very quick performance over Ethernet, telephone (VOIP) and Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE E HOGMAN

customer_reviews.title: Dependable and Fast Modem with phone ports
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice if you want to own your modem and not pay the $13/mo rental fee with Comcast Xfinity. Also, if you have triple play and need the phone ports or hook up for a fax, this is the right choice. Xfinity tells me it is identical to their rental unit, only difference is the color. Arris makes this product for Xfinity in black. And the modem also provides a faster internet. The only issue is Comcast had to send a person out to install, as the phone wouldn't hook up. A tech spent 30 mins on the phone with Comcast getting it done. It should have been an easy task that could be done by the consumer.
customer_reviews.author: Laurelia B

customer_reviews.title: You don't think 11 bucks a month is a lot...
customer_reviews.text: My Family has been with Comcast, when it first came out, those little black boxes, that you had to turn to the channel you wanted, and that's 40 years ago. With the Prices, of just renting these, you can see the expense over the years, just adding up, and it just made sense to purchase my own. Set Up was Super Easy, I had to call Comcast, and It was all taken care of in a matter of seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Lawed

customer_reviews.title: This device will not allow dynamic DNS address access
customer_reviews.text: I spent all day trying to get this to work. Tech support said it was impossible to change the Gateway address (but I googled it and did it while on phone). He still denied it. However, all of my servers accessed via dynamic DNS address failed. I could not even access than from inside my LAN, using the Dyndns address! I entered all the port forwards properly, and even turned off the firewall, but to no avail. It is also a scandal that Xfinity has not yet approved a DOCIS 3.1 telephony modem for use. My old Arris works, but is limited to 150 Mbps. This is going back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: JARome

customer_reviews.title: Was sent an item that was either returned or refurbished - though I was buying new
customer_reviews.text: I purchased what I thought was a brand new item. However, while trying to set this modem up (and several hours of calls between the internet provider and the manufacturer), it was determined that this item had been previously owned and the unique MAC number was already in their system - basically, rendering the modem totally useless. Spent most of my weekend trying to get this to work and ended up having to go back to what I had originally. Was told by internet provider this happens a lot and not to buy these types of items off of Amazon or Ebay, better to go through someplace like Best Buy,
customer_reviews.author: B Clark

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I was switching my internet from AT&T to Comcast Xfinity. Since Xfinity charges $14 per month rent, I decided to take my chance with a purchased modem/router. I selected this brand as Arris makes the modem/routers for both Xfinity and AT&T so I figured that they knew how to make good quality equipment that was definitely compatible with the Xfinity signal. I have had it for a month and have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Computer teacher

customer_reviews.title: Even he was rather amazed at the hoops he had to go through in ...
customer_reviews.text: After Comcast came out (charged me $60 to hook it up), it has been working flawlessly. Note - you will not be able to get this working yourself. I attempted to do it via the normal channels, i.e., their Philippine tech staff. They could not activate it, and said I had to schedule an on-site tech person to activate it. The tech guy had to "call upstairs" to get special authorization to activate it. Even he was rather amazed at the hoops he had to go through in order to activate this. So, add the $60 bucks into your final cost estimates.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Buick

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem - Auto setup flawless
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews about issues with setup I was hesitant to try purchase my own modem. I got tired to paying rental and finely decided to purchase the modem. I'm not very technical, so I needed this to work without a lot of additional steps, it setup itself. It is compatible with Xfinity and supported the VOIP phone line. I followed the instructions and within 15 to 20 minutes the system set itself up . Internet access was setup and the phone line worked in a very short time. After about a week, everything is working great and my cable bill dropped by $11.00/month (no more rental fees)
customer_reviews.author: MSKI

customer_reviews.title: USB port for charging devices only!
customer_reviews.text: The Arris surfboard is a reliable modem / router. However I wanted to install a USB drive to share files across the network and I realize the 2 USB ports cannot be used to connect USB drives nor printers. it can only be used to charge USB devices! This is really disappointing given the price point of the device. Most of other routers on the market offer NAS functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Wifi
customer_reviews.text: Comcast recommended this model to replace the voice modem I was renting from them. I did not realize that it was also an internet modem and wifi all-in-one. Needless to say Comcast subsequently informed me that I cannot limit the use to to the voice modem by itself, so I had to retire my brand new super fast Netgear modem and router in order to get both the internet and phone to work in my home. The wifi signal on this model is strong enough for maybe a modest apartment. Forget it if you own a single family home. Really bummed that I missed the return period by a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Decatur Staleys

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised with your Xfinity subscription. Follow the instruction pamphlets in the box and you should be good to go. One quick pointer is that when I tried the "xfinity.com/activate" URL after the modem was online; it did not connect so I chose the "Fix Network Connection" option to route me to the Comcast activation website so there is no need to call Comcast but they are there if needed be.
customer_reviews.author: Indy

customer_reviews.title: Not new was previously owned and missing paperwork
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the WiFi not transmitting when setting this router up. Spoke to Arris tech support and was told the router's serial number I have was registered with someone else, meaning this is not a new unit and was returned and is refurbished, reconditioned, or? I paid for a new router not for a used one!!!! This need to be rectified. I did get the router working.
customer_reviews.author: robkarrob

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT Handle Xfinity 1000 MBPS plan
customer_reviews.text: According to Xfinity this modem will NOT get 1000Mbps download speeds, it maxes out at 875 MBPS. So if you just updated to their 1000 MBPS plan this will not work. I have not found a modem that will do phone, internet and wifi so I purchased a phone/internet only and will run all my wifi through my router.
customer_reviews.author: Pnazz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Overall Experience
customer_reviews.text: Needed to call Arris 4 times to quadruple verify the modem was bad so that I can get a new one sent out. Mind you, every time you call in they have you reset your modem which involves quite a bit of annoyance as the modem isn't exactly located on top of my desk with easy access. After 4 months the modem is not working properly and quite cumbersome to have a replacement sent, and best of all they're charging me return shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Gio D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up for Xfinity Triple Play service
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy. Just hooked it up and provisioned it over the Xfinity web interface. Took about 20 minutes. Internet and phone both working without issue afterwards. Have the Xfinity 400MBS and getting around 450MBS downstream consistently. Has been up for 6 days since I hooked it up with no issues. It has been solid performance from it so far with no reboots or other issues. I have not had any of the problems with latency that the Puma chipset is supposed to have. Video streaming and online gaming are both good with no hiccups.
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: Vital setup instruction missing
customer_reviews.text: WARNING - you must log into the modem through 10.0.0.1 and set up an admin account before the modem will allow internet access - either through Cat5 OR WiFi. Neither the Xfinity nor the Arris tech support folks know this. And it isn't a step in the quick start guide. 7 days, 2 modems, 4 techs, 6 hours on the phone ... and the thing finally works. Yeah - it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rich S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money so far
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the router and modem for xfinity (Comcast) services. This is the one you need to purchase I tried others but it was not a combo deal. This one is def worth the money so far connected it under 35mins you do have to contact Comcast services to switch it over and stop paying that ridiculous price of $13 a month for rental if all works out as plan I will definitely be saving money. And so could you. Will update this post if anything changes
customer_reviews.author: Ddixon

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginner Modem
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my Modem/ Router combo used from the seller Chommy85 and packaging was horrible. One Walmart bag at the bottom and nothing else. I could feel the item unsecured and very loose tumbling all over inside. I can only imagine what it went through to get here. Edit: The seller reached out to me, apologized and we resolved the issue appropriately. Overall, it does a pretty good job spreading wifi signals throughout the house. It's a bit larger than I thought, but being a first Modem I can't find too much to complain about. It works and that's that.
customer_reviews.author: Zeldamaster

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for Comcast/ Xfinity rental modem!
customer_reviews.text: Should have purchased years ago. Xfinity continues to raise monthly modem rental rates - now up to $13/month. If you have Comcast phone and internet service this is an exact replica of their rental unit. Took some time on the phone with Xfinity tech support to activate the phone line - the trick is ensure you unplug all phones from wall jacks after Tech Support activates the modem then plug back in.
customer_reviews.author: gulfcoastdave

customer_reviews.title: Great cost saving Modem
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to save the expense of paying for a modem through XFINITY monthly. So far works fine. I have not needed tech support. This modem supports telephone and was one of two available and compatible with XFINITY. I figure it will pay for itself. It was highly recommended by Best Buy and the installer who stated it is a good product. I'll update if anything goes wrong. I did buy a protection package.
customer_reviews.author: Lucretia Sveda

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: CALL YOUR CABLE PROVIDER FIRST and let them help you install it!!! the customer service from India is AWFUL...trust me!!! I called xfinity tech support and we had it going within 30 minutes or so and it works PERFECTLY!!! i am Very happy with this purchase, but strongly encourage you to AVOID Arris customer support!!!
customer_reviews.author: JOHN B MCCOY

customer_reviews.title: Things you should know
customer_reviews.text: If you are or have purchased this Gateway, be aware that the MoCA feature CANNOT be turned on. I talk to the tech support at Comcast/Xfinity and they could not turn it on and suggest I call Arris; I did and was told that when they offered the Retail version, that the MoCA was to be locked out. This forces you to use the Comcast Gateway if you want to use the Xi6 4K client/set top box for your TV, MoCA is required and Xi6 is wireless. The regular features work great as long as MoCA is not required.
customer_reviews.author: H. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Want to save some money?
customer_reviews.text: Get rid of the rental modem you are paying for from your cable company. Get this instead, wish I had paid attention and done it sooner. I paid enough in rental to have gotten four or five of them. Take it home and plug it in, call and get a few adjustments and you are ready to go with your TV, internet, and phone (I still have a landline). JUST GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine

customer_reviews.title: Great for Comcast/Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!! If you have Comcast/Xfinity, you need to buy this! It is a little expensive up front but you will no longer have a modem rental fee on your bill. After a year and a half of not paying rental fees, you'll be saving money. This thing has more speed capacity than you'd ever need and the range is great. We have it in the center of our 2700 sqft house with no issues with dead zones. It even reaches outside. As long as it lasts at least two years, it's totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Nate Umb

customer_reviews.title: FAST!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason for the downgrade from a 5 was that the Modem/Router takes forever to get back online after a reboot. I originally had some problems with setting up Comcast and every reboot was 20-30 minutes. That having been said, it has been exceptionally reliable, it has fantastic range and it is lightning fast. However, on those rare occasions when I need to reboot, the timing is obnoxious. Nonetheless, I would not trade this for anything else I have ever used and I sorely tempted to push the review to a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Bueing

customer_reviews.title: Good Performance - would've liked it to be a little bit cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace the COMCAST/XFINITY Gateway that I was renting at $11 a month. The Software, Set UP, User Guide on this one is very improved compared to the TG862 - older generation Gateway that I just replaced. The AC1750 WIFI signal travels well in our 2-story house compared to the older Gateway. I just wish they were a little cheaper - I think ARRIS is milking the COMCAST/XFINITY certification that they have for this Product and overcharging customers - but we have no choice.. It is either this or the XFINITY one.
customer_reviews.author: arun zarabi

customer_reviews.title: Arris Tech Support is Great
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace the modem I was renting from my internet provider. Installing should have been a breeze except for the part where you contact your service provider to activate the modem - They were terrible - I spent over an hour with this so called "support" staff. However, I called Arris support and was up and running in 10 minutes. They were phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Peter Nardooley

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and set up
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my outdated modem with this one. Easy to install and connect to Comcast. Make sure the model you buy is on the approved cable provider list. Each device that currently connects will need to be reconnected in order to access the internet. This device combines the cable modem and the wireless router. I did not need to keep a separate wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: E Fleek

customer_reviews.title: Was good. Now awful.
customer_reviews.text: I am amending my original 5 star review, I'm now giving it a generous 2 stars. We've had this modem since February so the window for return has long since passed. The modem CONSTANTLY is resetting. Making any kind of streaming near impossible! Very frustrating when your trying to use the wifi for meetings!
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy Xfinity modem rental fee!
customer_reviews.text: If your like me and hate paying add on chicken s$&t junk rental fees, then this is for you! I paid the fee for years and did my research on the best option. Once the chicken s$&t fee jumped from $10 to $11 in 2018 I pulled the trigger. This modem will take less than 2 years to pay for it’s self. Now if there was a way to get around having to use the X1 box and just use the Xfinity app on a streaming device. Where I live I only have to options overpriced Stone Age AT&T and overpriced Xfinity
customer_reviews.author: Mark Matus

customer_reviews.title: Super easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the Xfinity modem and eliminate the monthly charge, which has been steadily increasing. It's quite fast, but what impressed me the most is that it practically set itself up-- really amazing compared with some I've struggled with. I also like that it's white with some accent colors rather than the inevitable dull black. That's a personal preference, YMMV. Very happy with it so far. Outside reviews give it high marks for reliability.
customer_reviews.author: isolate

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: Signed up for Comcast services and did not want to pay monthly router rent. Pays for itself in about a year. Works just fine. I’ve read reviews saying that router recycles by itself, or WiFi disappears - this is not happening to me. 6 weeks and running fine. Stronger signal than I had before, don’t need WiFi extenders any longer. Looks neat and clean in white.
customer_reviews.author: b_k_l

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Xfinity phone
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the specific product. Xfinity listed this as one of the telephony modems that worked for their cable/internet/phone. HOWEVER that was NOT the case. After the self install didn’t allow the phone to work (cable and internet was perfect) an Xfinity technician came to my house and also could NOT get it to work. They could not explain why their website said it should work. Ended up returning and getting the Motorola MT7711 (another option from their list) and it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great modem for Xfinity Triple Play!
customer_reviews.text: Recently added a voice line to my Xfinity account and was tired of paying rental fees so I decided to take a chance with this modem. Device works extremely well! Most of the negative reviews appear to be over two years old so maybe Comcast has finally added this as a supported device, installation was a breeze. Although I did have to call their support line to provision my voice line. Internet and wireless signal worked right out of the box and I was able to configure my network from my laptop (without ethernet port). I purchased a refurbished unit that arrived in excellent condition. Should've purchased sooner!
customer_reviews.author: George Pegram

customer_reviews.title: Getting good signals
customer_reviews.text: I have had this modem for several month now and I bought to replace my ARRIS SURFboard modem that did not have a phone option. My service before did not include phone service, so I was quite happy with my previous ARRIS modem. But when I changed providers and added the phone service, I needed to upgrade my modem with that option. This modem is functioning just like the other one and I am very pleased with the speed. So far I have not found any issues with this device. I will try to update this if things change.
customer_reviews.author: MRTN

customer_reviews.title: Hard to set-up!
customer_reviews.text: Only giving two stars because the set-up was so difficult, spent over hour and a half with Comcast on the phone trying to get this registered then once registered couldn't get it to connect to the internet. Comcast said they couldn't do anything else then I Called Arris spent another hour and half on the phone trying to get it to connect to the internet. Finally got it up and running after making some changes, seems to be running Ok for now but spent my Saturday afternoon on something I really felt was unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: Go Blue!

customer_reviews.title: ARRIS Cable Modem & Wi-Fi Router with VOIP cable Phone Connection
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our cable modem & wifi router with the ARRIS SURFboard SVG2482AC because it includes VOIP cable phone connection. We now use our Xfinity triple play. Our family runs our LAN, wifi and cable phone through the device without any problems. Because we intend to keep it more than a year, it is better to buy than rent from the cable company.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: don't bother with these items they stop working at anytime 1 month, 2 , 3, 5 months just are not well made!! components are cheap and do not last!!! do your research before hand so you are not buying cheap junk!!
customer_reviews.author: THE MICK

customer_reviews.title: Bye-bye Comcast rental
customer_reviews.text: This cable modem replaced the one provided (as a rental) by Comcast. It is easy to set up if you follow the directions and remember to jot down the settings on the side of the modem (you'll need them for installation). For the first time, my download speeds reached the level promised by Comcast; in fact they exceeded the promised level. The cable modem is compatible only with Comcast so make sure it will work with your ISP. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Klein

customer_reviews.title: I should have done this a year ago
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while, and it works flawlessly. I was surprised that I did not have to change my passwords on any of my devices. After installation and calling Comcast to connect this new modem, everything stayed the same.
customer_reviews.author: Paul from Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play.
customer_reviews.text: This Surfboard, in my instance, was plug and play. Xfinity service is a TriPlay, TV, Internet, Phone. The Surfboard was swapped for the Xfinity unit. The internet connection was established after the unit was powered up. I signed into the Xfinity account and answered a few questions. Surfboard was automatically authorized by Xfinity. The phone feature, as * in the instructions, required a call to Xfinity to send a signal to the modem. All of this was accomplished without human contact. Modem was delivered a day early :-) , packaging was excellent and the unit operates as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cable wireless router!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the signal range is much better than the Comcast rental, especially the 2.4g signal. 5g signal range is weaker than the 2.4g, but it still reaches my entire home. I highly recommend it and it saves you $120/year in rental fees!
customer_reviews.author: Ego1982

customer_reviews.title: Good modem, no more renting
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I have Comcast and the installation process was pretty easy. I called Comcast and they removed my rental modem and added this one. They walked me through the configuration and it took me around 30 - 45 mins to finish everything. It has phone jack and works perfectly for the Comcast voice plan. Strongly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Mai

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. So far blazing fast with no stalls. My 3rd Arris in 12 years...they’ve all been great. The only thing is that this is a large white plastic box....bigger than most router/modems..... Ok for me, but someone with limited space should double check the exterior dimensions to ensure it will fit where you want it. It’s huge.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Love

customer_reviews.title: Internal network doesn't work when internet service goes down.
customer_reviews.text: What moron thought it was a good idea to make this cable modem combo with an internal network that doesn't work when the internet provider has service problems? Want to print with your network printer within your internal network? Forget about it. Want to access your IP camera within the internal network? Forget about it. I made a mistake when I bought this piece of crap. Never buy these all in one things. Get a voice/data modem only, get a separate router to plug in to it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Xfinity replacement!.
customer_reviews.text: It does everything it is purported to do very well. This is my 2nd one. I had a wireless issue with the 1st one and it was out of warranty. The company volunteered to replace it - WOW! The whole tech support thing was handled exceptionally well and I only wish i could buy other items from Arris as they are terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Pro Bowler

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: This is my second ARRIS modem. The first would not connect with my landline and had to be sent back. I almost didn't get the replacement but am glad I did. The tech support was excellent -- especially when it looked like I would have the same problem connecting the phone. The technician stayed with me even though it took forever with many restarts.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L Parson

customer_reviews.title: Improved signal
customer_reviews.text: I do not care for white color but more importantly, I was able to replace Comcast equipment with this modem/router and it also provides clear reception on landline phone. It was installed by a friend who has experience with this. What took him 45 minutes would have taken me much longer to connect. This is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: dianez

customer_reviews.title: Completely compatible with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. What's major is the cost. It would be foolish to rent monthly from a provider when you can own this for the same amount of payments you would pay a provider in a year. Plus, you will pay that provider forever! Who wants to do that? From what I've experienced so far with the Arris "Surf Board" router/modem, I'm completely sold.
customer_reviews.author: Edward L.

customer_reviews.title: Get all the speed you're paying for!
customer_reviews.text: After Comcast increased download speeds in my area, my old voice modem could not keep up. I bought this model to keep up with (hopefully) future speed increases. I'm supposed to be getting 250 Mbps, but am actually getting 300, give or take. Easy setup; activated the internet service online, and the voice service took one painless automated phone call. Up and ready in about 20 minutes tops. It took longer to set up and connect the new WiFi network, which is also great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Meuler

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: I worked with Comcast technicians for over 2 hours but could not get a connection. Comcast decided that the problem was probably software in the router. Also talked to an ARRIS technician who said there was nothing wrong with router and the problem was with Comcast. I finally gave up and reinstalled the Comcast router.
customer_reviews.author: mike8928

customer_reviews.title: Nice Moden
customer_reviews.text: Nice modem. I have xfinity. The only issues are that maybe three times since I purchased it a few months ago, I had trouble finding connecting my TV. I am pretty sure that it was a modem problem and not the tv, because the gateway showed that the tv was connected although it wasn't and only restarting the modem (rather than the TV) or erasing the tv's info from the modem and completing setup all over again, fixed the problem. Also, it is a very large item and does not fit in my kitchen cabinet or "gadget nook", so it is a bit of an eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: K. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service by Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: After about 2 weeks the Internet and WiFI stopped working - would not load internet or WiFI. Called Amazon to exchange or refund money and because it was ONE day past their 30 day warranty which includes shipping days they would do nothing! I had to ship it to ARRIS and they will be shipping me a new/repaired modem. At leaset 2 weeks down. I am not happy with Amazon, I think the shipping days should not be included in the 30 day warranty. I will have to buy local for most of my stuff now, because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Smk

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Easy to set up. Unplugged the old modem and plugged this in, connected ethernet cable to laptop, waited a few minutes for a connection, opened up a browser > went to xfinity.com/activate > entered account info > followed set up steps. Did not even need to call Comcast to provision. Their online activation setup works well. In a matter of minutes I was up and running. My plan includes 400mbps speeds and this modem was finally able to reach the peak speeds advertised by xfinity. The older modem peaked around 250mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Cary M. Soriano

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my needs
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our new house but it didn’t put out a strong enough WiFi signal for our wireless cable receiver boxes, so we’ll have to send back. Also the installer kept having trouble with bypassing whatever part of this modnnem would be used for phone service since we don’t have a land line. Kind of disappointing - I had high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Yo Mamma

customer_reviews.title: Wifi tends to go in and out
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to be able to save money on my infinity bill. I was able save $15 on my bill but the Wi-Fi tends to go in and out randomly. I work from home and it can be very aggravating when I really need it. other than that it is pretty fast when the Wi-Fi is working.
customer_reviews.author: Jamila Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Works great in IL for Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Install and activation took about 10-20 minutes. Old modem (TG862G) was due for an upgrade from Comcast so I decided to buy this one to avoid the $11 monthly charge. I activated the modem online and did not have to talk to anyone at Comcast. The phone service came back online as part of the activation too. Very easy and quick to get installed and activated. I have triple play Internet/Phone/X1 in the Chicago IL area and this modem works perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: CES

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a year. Just started constantly losing internet connection.
customer_reviews.text: I am connected through an Ethernet cord. There are no issues with my service and all troubleshooting leads to the router/modem. Did all of the basic stuff, reset, turn off, etc. For the price I would not recommend this to anyone who wants something to work longer than a year.... I am going to see if i can contact there support to get a replacement. And will update my review depending on that.
customer_reviews.author: fodog

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and stops working quickly
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and it worked fine (for a few weeks), that is until you can't return it. Our internet worked great, and then without any cause, the wifi stops working every 20 minutes. Tech support is no help AT ALL. my calls were either cut short (they disconnect me twice) or they had no solution besides turn it off and back on again. just pass by this one and get a different router.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: poor router
customer_reviews.text: does great speeds wired.speeds drop off significantly on wifi can not cover a whole home either,range is really poor and now after 6 months the power cable is finicky and needs to be wigled to stay lit
customer_reviews.author: Excel

customer_reviews.title: Misleading, I want my money back
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit on the advertising on the box of 1Gbps internet speeds. Now I find out that it does not work with 1Gbps speeds? W.T.H? This is a crock of you know what. Arris needs to make good and buy back my unit so I can get one that can REALLY download 1Gbps. Bad news for Arris. Really bad news. Let me know if anyone is doing a class action lawsuit - I will gladly join it.
customer_reviews.author: MikeS

customer_reviews.title: Thinking about cutting that CC cable modem monthly rental fee? Do it.  It’s easier than you think.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy config and just plain works. 100% compatible with Comcast requirements including voice. Comcast activated painlessly with a short phone call. Great product if you’re trying to get away from equipment rentals from cable utilities.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: I love this new device it does exactly what I need and want to help selling everything they need to do around the house perfect
customer_reviews.author: Joseph j Arnold jr

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a refurbished one--stupid me! Was on the phone with Comcast forever trying to get it connected. Could not do as it still had the ORIGINAL OWNER'S information in the router. Really!!!!! Called the company that sent it and they said there was nothing they could do so they would refund my money but just throw it away! I have learned my lesson....hope this helps others.
customer_reviews.author: chester mandella

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I also bought this gateway to replace an existing older model with my Xfinity plan, and I was a little peeved to have to buy one that also supports VOIP since I don't really use it, but I suppose that's more of an Xfinity gripe. Setup started out okay, but I ended up having to call Xfinity because I still couldn't get a connection even after getting their setup page. Their tech support "reset" something and magically everything started working. WiFi connection speed seems faster and more consistent thus far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Works with land lines
customer_reviews.text: I had cable problems and the tech from Comcast said it was my modem so he helped me find this one. turns out the problem like usual was Comcast service issues, I had looked for the last 2 years for a modem that supports land lines and this one does. Set up was easy until we had to call Comcast to set it up with them, it works great and esy tofollow instructions included.
customer_reviews.author: Jenelle Krueger

customer_reviews.title: MoCa is supported
customer_reviews.text: MoCa is fully supported by this device, but the menu is hidden, no one is trained on it and there is no documentation or handbook on it. You log in to the modem as admin, then manually enter your_ip/moca.php (e.g. 10.0.0.1/moca.php ). That will give you access to the Gateway > Connection > MoCA menu where you can turn on and manage the MoCa capabilities. Handles a lot of devices well (two kids on tablets streaming youtube, computer working on the network while streaming netflix). Overall I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

product_meta.title: ARRIS SURFboard SVG2482AC DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem & AC1750 dual-band Wi-Fi Router with Voice, Certified for Xfinity Internet & Voice (white)
product_meta.description: The Surfboard SVG2482AC is the first retail Wi-Fi modem to feature rdk-b and is optimized for use with Xfinity Internet & Voice service. Rdk-b is an open-source software standard for accelerating the delivery of the latest entertainment and broadband services. It enables cable Internet Providers to quickly and efficiently deliver next-gen products and services directly to the devices on their network. With Wi-Fi speeds up to 1750 Mbps, download speeds up to 1 Gbps (not approved for Gigabit speed Internet plan) and 2 telephone lines, the SVG2482AC is the perfect solution to kick your XFINITY home network into high gear! Add a battery backup (sold separately) for coverage during power outages. Put the power back in your control with surfboard.
feature_bullets: 4 products in 1: DOCSIS 3. 0 Cable Modem, AC1750 Wi-Fi Access Point, 4-Port Gigiabit Ethernet Router & Xfinity Telephony Modem.
Approved for use with Xfinity internet & voice service. Not compatible with any other cable internet provider.
24 downstream x 8 upstream DOCSIS 3.0 channels, best for Xfinity internet speed plans up to 600 Mbps
4 Gigabit Ethernet ports, 2 telephony ports for digital voice service
